summary: I am active as a consultant, project and process manager and (risk-taking) business developer. I do so with a strong focus on the water sector. From Sanitation to Water Supply, from Integrated Water Resources Management to Irrigation. My educational background is generic, which allows me to interact with a broad range of professionals. From engineers to policy makers. From NGO’s to entrepreneurs. Having worked in the water sector since 2007, I have developed a broad understanding of the worlds’ water challenges, as well as a vision on how to cope with these. I have developed specific knowledge and expertise on water supply and sanitation in developing countries, through my work for the Netherlands Water Partnership and WASTE, both in the Netherlands as well as in Mozambique. Next to my work as an independent consultant, I am a partner of EWB, a Dutch start-up in climate adaptation, specifically in storm water management and treatment.

projects.title: Nutrient Platform - Network building and transition management

contributors.headline: Strategic international advisor at International Department Ministry of I&W
Process technology, design and optimization in industrial water treatment.
senior researcher at Plant Research International
Trainer and coach for personal development (incl YEP Programmes), Consultant & Facilitator International Development Programs

profile_positions.description: EWB designs and builds underground rainwater harvesting and treatment systems as a solution to the negative effects of climate change: heavy rainfall, drought and salinization. With our patented Urban Rain Shell-system we store and purify rainwater with natural, circular and renewable materials. We buffer storm water in underground beds of 'AA Ecoshell Mix' and at the same time purify the runoff water of heavy metals, mineral oils and PAH’s with the innovative mineral mix 'AA Minerals'. As a result, we are able to infiltrate the water in groundwater protection areas and water catchment areas to prevent drought and salinization. Or we can store it in aquifers, where we create a fresh water bubble. With the URS we make rainwater available again for use in all sorts of applications for which currently drinking water is used. For example, sprinkler water for sports fields or greeneries, firefighting water, process water or as play water on squares in residential areas. This way, we save drinking water and make rainwater a source again instead of a sore.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description: Als geassocieerd partner van Syntraal ben ik een onderdeel van het team Klimaatadaptatie & Warmtetransitie. Voor het team ben ik medeverantwoordelijk voor de activiteiten in Midden en West Nederland. Ik concentreer mij hierin op klimaat-adaptieve maatregelen in de stad en bij de industrie. We doen dit vanuit een praktische insteek, met focus op de techniek en de uitvoeringskant. Syntraal heeft hierin al aangetoond om slimme klimaat-adaptieve oplossingen in de markt te zetten met hun vennootschapppen in onder anderen @AquaBASE en @Amfius. Naast geassocieerd partner voor Syntraal ben ik ook actief m.b.t. het ontwikkelen en opschalen van diverse water gerelateerde innovaties die door mijn vader zijn ontwikkeld, waarbij hier ook nadrukkelijk de samenwerkingsmogelijkheden met Syntraal worden onderzocht. . Het gaat hier o.a. over Urban Rainshell, een innovatief waterbergings- en –zuiveringssysteem dat dient als oplossing voor wateroverlast én droogte als gevolg van klimaatverandering en wordt vermarkt onder de naam EWB (www.ewb.solutions).
profile_positions.title: Verbinder Water & Klimaat – Syntraal Associate

profile_positions.description: The Pancake Effect is the name of the consultancy company of Ger Pannekoek. Through The Pancake Effect, I contribute to concrete solutions for the worlds' water challenges. I am active as a consultant, project and process manager and risk-taking business developer. The Pancake Effect is about making (unusual) connections, networking and building partnerships. It's about providing an honest and critical advise, while not being afraid to rock the boat or think out of the box. It's about bringing projects to a good end, with focus on long-term impact, rather than short-term results. Moreover, I use my network and knowledge about the water sector, to help companies to bring their innovative water solutions to the market. Above all, through The Pancake Effect I put loads of energy in everything I do and always try to have fun.
profile_positions.title: Independent consultant | project and process manager | business developer

profile_positions.description: As independent consultant, I supported the Netherlands Water Partnership in the further development of their Finance for Water strategy and activities, with the aim to bridge the gap between water & finance.
profile_positions.title: Finance for Water adviser

profile_positions.description: Representing WASTE in the Dutch WASH SDG Alliance in Nepal. Programme and partnership development with other Dutch and Nepalese NGO's with focus on the Diamond Approach, building markets in stead of taps or toilets. In other words: building a sustainable system of local governments, households, businesses and financiers.
profile_positions.title: Country Manager WASH SDG Nepal

profile_positions.description: Responsible for realizing water supply projects in Mozambique and other upcoming markets. Our mission is to improve drinking water purification, water storage and water distribution in developing countries and upcoming markets. With a focus on standardization and modular design, by creating partnerships with local entrepreneurs and by using proven technologies and certified products, the PUREleau® solutions are self build packages, robust, reliable, flexible, low of maintenance, economically affordable and applicable for all types of water sources.
profile_positions.title: Business Developer Mozambique and other upcoming marketes

profile_positions.description: Sharing lessons learned Netherlands Water Partnership to Plataforma Moçambicana de Água (PLAMA). This with the aim to build a financially self-sustaining public-private network in the Mozambican water sector. A network that improves cooperation between the public and private sector in Mozambique and at the same time acts as an entry point for international cooperation between the Mozambican water sector and water sectors abroad, amongst others the Dutch Water Sector.
profile_positions.title: Resident Project Officer TA PLAMA

profile_positions.description:
On behalf of WASTE, I advised the Frysian Urban Sanitation Program (FUSP) on issues related to sustainability, private sector development and innovative financing in sanitation in the Mozambican municipalities of Chimoio, Gondola, Manica and Beira.

I advised FUSP in the implementation of the Diamond Approach, focusing on buidling markets in stead of toilets. In other words: building a sustainable system of local governments, households, businesses and financiers. 

FUSP is a program of the Province of Friesland, the Water Authority for Friesland (Wetterskip Fryslân), the water supply company Vitens and the Frisian local authorities. The program is co-financed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Business & Sanitation Advisor in Frysian Urban Sanitation Program
Project Manager UNICEF-WASTE Partnership

profile_positions.description: Connecting sanitation demand in low income markets (BoP) to technology, knowledge, expertise of innovative private sector organisations. Developing new innovative business models for sanitation, with a strong emphasis on value chain development and the reuse of Pee and Poo for food and energy.
profile_positions.title: Business Adviser

profile_positions.description: Responsible for management existing partnerships Akvo.org in Mozambique and development of new  partnerships. Akvo is a not-for-profit foundation that creates open source, internet and mobile software and sensors. We work with people improving infrastructure and services, for disadvantaged populations.
profile_positions.title: Satellite Mozambique

profile_positions.description:
The Borrel of the Pyramid introduces young professionals to the world of entrepreneurial development. Two billion people in the world survive on 2 Dollars per day or less, the so-called Base of the Pyramid, and we have noticed an increasing number of young people that are appalled by this situation. People that are determined to contribute to the eradication of poverty and the improvement of livelihoods at the Base of the Pyramid. 

We believe that structural improvement can be established by focusing on entrepreneurial development. By viewing people in Southern countries not as victims, but as value-conscious consumers. Consumers that have their own demands for high-quality products and services. This creates a market that challenges entrepreneurs and companies to be creative and innovative. To come up with products and services that fit local conditions and that are still affordable for local consumers.

The Borrel of the Pyramid focuses on bringing together the unbound potentiality of young professionals from different sectors and countries, and challenges them to contribute to improve the situation at the Base of the Pyramid. Hereby our focus is not only on the people that are active within the development sector, but especially on so-called unusual suspects from the private sector. We do this by offering a platform on which young professionals, with a heart for entrepreneurial development, can connect with each other and meet likeminded spirits. We also inspire them by introducing real-life cases in which they are challenged to find a creative and innovative solution to an existing problem.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder
